title: WATCH: Blend your own wine on Holland America Line's new ms Koningsdam
text: WATCH: Blend your own wine on Holland America Line's new ms Koningsdam WATCH: Blend your own wine on Holland America Line's new ms Koningsdam PASSENGERS on Holland America Line's new ms Koningsdam will be able to create their own wine when it launches in April 2016. PUBLISHED: 00:00, Thu, Oct 8, 2015 | UPDATED: 15:37, Thu, Oct 8, 2015 PH Passengers will now be able to blend their own wine The first purpose-built wine-blending venue at sea will give passengers the chance to learn about wine-making and get creative themselves. The paid-for venue, called BLEND, is being run in collaboration with the oldest winery in Washington State, Chateau Ste. Michelle. Up to 10 guests at a time will be able to blend their own wine then enjoy it at dinner or in the privacy of their stateroom. Sitting around the BLEND tasting table, guests will learn about wine from the ship's expert, then choose a selection from five barrels of single-vineyard red wine to create their own blend. Orlando Ashford, president of Holland America Line, says: "At the core of every Holland America Line cruise is our desire to offer unique, immersive and innovative experiences, and BLEND by Chateau Ste. PH The new cruise ship from Holland America Line, ms Koningsdam At the core of every Holland America Line cruise is our desire to offer unique, immersive and innovative experiences, and BLEND by Chateau Ste Orlando Ashford, president of Holland America Line Michelle is all of those things and more. "The BLEND experience on Koningsdam is designed to appeal to everyone, and it will be exciting for our guests to create an exclusive wine tailored to their personal taste that they can enjoy onboard with our exceptional cuisine." Each session will start with a welcome video by Bob Bertheau, Chateau Ste. Michelle's winemaker, then guests will learn about the history of Washington wines and winemaking. This will involve examining soil samples to understand how the soil and the vineyard's site has an impact on the flavours and style of the wine. Guests will also learn about the characteristics, flavours and nuances to look for in the wine from each of the barrels. While sampling these five unique wines, which could include Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot from the winery's Cold Creek and Canoe Ridge Estate vineyards, they will make tasting notes on what they like about each wine. Then, using a graduated cylinder to see how much of each different wine they are using, they can blend a certain amount of the wines they like together. PH The main dining room of the new ship This will be put into a stoppered bottle, which they can personalise by creating their own label. The bottle of wine will be sent to The Dining Room, or another restaurant, for the guests to enjoy with their evening meal or they can take their wine to their stateroom to enjoy. For more information about the new ship and its itineraries, go to www.hollandamerica.co.uk . Related articles
